basics.name: Chaselyn Pugh
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a student at the University of Hawaii, studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences. I expect to graduate in 2018.

highlights: Provided techinical consulting to a Department of Defence client by providing in-depth analysis to characterize malicious activity and provide new innovative ways of discovering cyber activity.
Utilized Python scripts to automate data manipulation and improve analysis across target sets and increase analysis efficiency
Created C++ analytics to parse, extract, and normalize data, enabling intelligence analysis that otherwise would have been unavailable
Conducted malware analysis to enable further understanding of tactics, techniques and protocols of advanced persisten threats (APTS)

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
